item.title: By: Jamie
item.dc:creator: Jamie
item.description: <p>I think you're referring to NoteMan 1.x; yeah ScanEZ was better. However, a couple of months ago, NoteMan 2.x was released. With a new UI, it does virtually everything ScanEZ does except the replication auditor. And much more, such as editing rich text fields, finding docs by web url, changing the name of attachments in place, comparing docs across dbs. NoteMan 2.0 does almost everything in fewer clicks, and most actions perform faster in NoteMan than in ScanEZ. NoteMan is 100% Notes, so it requires no DLLs and even works on the Linux client. See this for comparison { <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.noteman.com/8525725E0063505E/ID/NMCompare"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.noteman.com/8525725E0063505E/ID/NMCompare"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }</p>
item.content:encoded: I think you’re referring to NoteMan 1.x; yeah ScanEZ was better. However, a couple of months ago, NoteMan 2.x was released. With a new UI, it does virtually everything ScanEZ does except the replication auditor. And much more, such as editing rich text fields, finding docs by web url, changing the name of attachments in place, comparing docs across dbs. NoteMan 2.0 does almost everything in fewer clicks, and most actions perform faster in NoteMan than in ScanEZ. NoteMan is 100% Notes, so it requires no DLLs and even works on the Linux client. See this for comparison { http://www.noteman.com/8525725E0063505E/ID/NMCompare“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

item.title: By: Vince Schuurman
item.dc:creator: Vince Schuurman
item.description: <p>Agreed, Ytria tools are great, and i'm not just saying that because they have an ad on OpenNTF <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLU/$File/wink.gif"</a> /></p>
item.content:encoded: Agreed, Ytria tools are great, and i’m not just saying that because they have an ad on OpenNTF http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLU/$File/wink.gif“ />

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Scot,<br /><br />I have tried it and although it's cheaper the functionality doesn't come close to the Ytria suite. I guess it's true that you get what you pay for.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Scot,

I have tried it and although it’s cheaper the functionality doesn’t come close to the Ytria suite. I guess it’s true that you get what you pay for.

Matt

item.title: By: Scot
item.dc:creator: Scot
item.description: <p>Also check out NoteMan by MartinScott. I have found this tool invaluable and is a lot less expensive.<br/><br /><br/><br />{ <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.noteman.com/"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.noteman.com/"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }</p>
item.content:encoded:
Also check out NoteMan by MartinScott. I have found this tool invaluable and is a lot less expensive.

{ http://www.noteman.com/“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }
